intro: Darniella gymnomaschala, commonly known as the naked stem dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Darniella gymnomaschala is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
